hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Zone Breakout with Options Flow Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC price approaches a major options expiration level (monthly/quarterly) within ±1% during NEUTRAL regime, and there's significant call buying (put/call ratio < 0.7) at that strike, a daily close through the level with >$1B in spot volume will trigger a liquidity grab continuation move of 3-5% in 2-3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Options strikes act as liquidity magnets. Market makers hedge dynamically, creating self-fulfilling price movements. Call buying indicates institutional positioning for upside. The breakout triggers stop losses and forces dealer hedging.
entry_conditions: BTC price within ±1% of major monthly/quarterly options strike
Deribit BTC options put/call ratio < 0.7 for past 24h
Daily close through the strike level (above for call-heavy, below for put-heavy)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 4% move beyond strike level OR 3 days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close back through strike level in opposite direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price fails to move >2% beyond strike within 48 hours OR immediate reversal on low volume (<$500M).
